title: Entry Pointmain
extract: In computer programming, an entry point is where the first instructions in a program are executed, and where the program has access to command line arguments. ... For some operating systems and programming languages, the entry point is in a runtime library, a set of support functions for the language.
extract_html: In computer programming, an entry point is where the first instructions in a program are executed, and where the program has access to command line arguments. ... For some operating systems and programming languages, the entry point is in a runtime library, a set of support functions for the language.
